summary: Git release tag has a typo with an extra dot after 'v' (v.1.36.0 instead of v1.36.0). This was reported and subsequently fixed.
userImpact: Users may encounter confusion or incorrect tag references when trying to use or reference the specific release version.
rootCause: Typo in the git release tag creation process with an extra dot after the 'v' prefix.
resolutionDetails: The issue was resolved by @bergundy with the correct tag being created.
keyQuote: https://github.com/temporalio/api/releases/tag/v.1.36.0 should be `v1.36.0`, extra dot after `v` in the git tag.
